title: Alexandra Cane lashes back at Strictly's Craig Revel Horwood over talentless Love Islanders jibe

Strictly Come Dancing judge Craig Revel Horwood has been challenged over his claims that Love Islanders are 'talentless'.

Former Love Island star Alexandra Cane has called out the judge for his rude remarks and swiped back by posting a video of herself ballroom dancing.

The reality TV babe, 28, was responding to Craig after he told Daily Star on Sunday that: "Strictly is meant to showcase people with talents in acting, singing, sports, journalism... not fame-seekers with no discernible talent."

Alexandra was not impressed by Craig's comments and criticised the straight-talking judge for his generalisation about people who have starred in the hit ITV2 dating show.

(Image: Instagram)

She shared a screenshot of the article to her Instagram and Twitter feeds with the caption: "Very interesting article.

"Funnily enough I actually used to compete in Latin American AND Ballroom dancing."

The former Love Islander then challenged the BBC judge: "Get me on the show and I will prove you VERY wrong. @bbcstrictly @CraigRevHorwood."

Posting an impressive video of her in dance training, Alexandra mocked: "Is this talentless @bbcstrictly ????"

(Image: WireImage)

Judge Craig recently let rip on reality TV stars as he slated the Love Islanders.

He said: "Love Island is for people who aren't celebrities, who've done nothing in their life and are trying to be someone and get something to be famous."

Fans of the former Love Island beauty instantly jumped to her defence and begged BBC to end their reality star ban for good.

(Image: Instagram)

One wrote: "I wholeheartedly support this! Just because you did a reality show doesn't mean you have no talent."

While another shared: "Talentless?? All I see in this is pure talent, beautiful ballroom hold!!"

A third posted: "Get her on Strictly now."

Strictly Come Dancing bosses have spent years shunning reality TV stars but this series they adapted the rules.

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Ken McKay/ITV/REX)

The show has long snubbed famous faces who have made their name on reality shows like Love Island, Towie and MIC.

However, Made In Chelsea's Jamie Laing became the first reality regular to land a place in the show this year.

Sadly, his run ended in disaster as he hurt his foot during the first group dance and had to pull out.

A source told The Sun : "It is a surprising U-turn from the BBC and Strictly.

"They said previously that low-rent reality stars like Jamie would not be allowed on the show but things now seem to have changed."
description: The former Love Island star posted a video of herself ballroom dancing after Craig Revel Horwood claimed the show's stars are 'talentless'
